subject: Hannah Storm: Country Music Mecca

       May 14, 
      2007

 
Greetings from Las Vegas, 
      
 
I'm in Vegas for one of 
      my favorite events of the year, the Academy of Country Music Awards, which will be broadcast tomorrow night on CBS at 
      8 p.m. ET/7 p.m. 
      CT. 
 
All the biggest stars 
      in country music are rolling into town for what promises to be a 
      great show that will be chock full 
      of live music performances. Yesterday, I sat in on Carrie Underwood's rehearsal 
      and was just blown away by how confidant and in control she seems this year. Last year, at this time, 
      she was fresh off of "American 
      Idol" and the new kid on the block. 
      I asked her about the difference that this past year has made in her life. Carrie told 
      me that not only has she learned a lot, 
      but that staying close to her mom has kept her grounded during this 
      whirlwind year, during which she has 
      become a huge crossover star. And coming right off of Mother's Day, 
      I loved hearing her talk about that.
 
But the mother 
      daughter-relationship can also be painful, as we saw this morning in Kelli 
      Pickler's live performance of her new single,"I Wonder." Kelli's mom left her family when Kelli was just two, leaving her with a father who 
      struggled with substance abuse and was in and out of jail most of her 
      childhood (Kelli frequently lived with her 
      grandparents, Faye and Clyde Pickler). Kelli wrote the song as a message to her mother; behind-the-scenes, we were all near tears as she sang 
      it. After she was done singing, 
      I just felt compelled to give her a huge hug! She's such a sweet 
      girl.
 
And to round things out, 
      we had another up-and-comer, Miranda Lambert, whose album "Crazy Ex-Girlfriend" is on top of the country charts. The 
      title for it explains 
      her big-time 
      Texas tough attitude (remember her first hit 
      single was called "Kerosene"!) 
 
And that's just the 
      beginning of our coverage. We'll have an all- star cast on the show tomorrow, including Reba McEntire, Vince Gill, 
      Brooks & Dunn and Rascal Flatts. How's 
      that for a country party!
 
Also tomorrow, from New York, we'll have the 
      live announcement of the nominations for this year's Tony Awards. 
      
 
I'll see you tomorrow from 
      Vegas!
 
      
Hannah StormEarlyShow@cbs.com
